trans-unit.source: Enables interaction with the user interface of the development environment object that is hosting the designer.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.IUIService> can display error messages, show dialog boxes, and get ambient properties of the host, such as the font for dialog boxes and color schemes, through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.IUIService.Styles%2A> dictionary property.
Indicates whether the component can display a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm"></xref>.
Component editors can display a component editor form that is similar to a property page from the Component Object Model (COM).
This method checks to determine whether the specified component has a <xref:System.ComponentModel.ComponentEditor> that can display a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm>.
The component to check for support for displaying a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm"></xref>.
`true` if the specified component can display a component editor form; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the window that should be used as the owner when showing dialog boxes.
Some dialog boxes are parented to an owner application and are not visible in the task list.

This method returns an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window> that indicates the window that should be the owner for dialog boxes of this sort that are spawned from an integrated development environment.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window"></xref> that indicates the window to own any child dialog boxes.
Sets a flag indicating the UI has changed.
This method indicates that the UI has been changed and should be refreshed.
It is important to indicate the need for a refresh whenever a toolbar or menu item's status changes.
Most development environments cache the status of these elements for speed, and need to know when they need to be updated.
This method is called, for example, after objects have been selected within designer view to enable the cut and copy menu items.
Attempts to display a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm"></xref> for a component.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm> is similar to a property page from the Component Object Model (COM).
If the component does not support component editors, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.
To avoid this, be sure to call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.IUIService.CanShowComponentEditor%2A> first.
The component for which to display a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window"></xref> to parent any dialog boxes to.
`true` if the attempt is successful; otherwise, `false`.
The component does not support component editors.
Attempts to display the specified form in a dialog box.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form"></xref> to display.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult"></xref> values indicating the result code returned by the dialog box.
Displays the specified exception and information about the exception in a message box.
Using this method enables the message box display to be properly integrated with the development environment.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> to display.
Displays the specified error message in a message box.
Using this method enables the message box display to be properly integrated with the development environment.
The error message to display.
Displays the specified exception and information about the exception in a message box.
Using this method enables the message box display to be properly integrated with the development environment.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> to display.
A message to display that provides information about the exception.
Displays the specified message in a message box.
This method ensures that the display of the message box is properly integrated with the development environment.
The message to display
Displays the specified message in a message box with the specified caption.
This method ensures that the display of the message box is properly integrated with the development environment.
The message to display.
The caption for the message box.
Displays the specified message in a message box with the specified caption and buttons to place on the dialog box.
This method ensures that the display of the message box is properly integrated with the development environment.
The message to display.
The caption for the dialog box.

One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons"></xref> values: <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons.OK"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons.OKCancel"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons.YesNo"></xref>, or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons.YesNoCancel"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult"></xref> values indicating the result code returned by the dialog box.
Displays the specified tool window.
A <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> identifier for the tool window.
This can be a custom <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> or one of the predefined values from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.StandardToolWindows"></xref>.
`true` if the tool window was successfully shown; `false` if it could not be shown or found.
Gets the collection of styles that are specific to the host's environment.
The dictionary can provide information from the host environment.
At a minimum, this consists of the font that should be used for standard UI text, and the color to use for highlighting.
These required styles are "DialogFont" and "HighlightColor".
The values for these styles may be retrieved by using the style as a key for the dictionary, accessing the dictionary using the key as an indexer.
For example: (object implementing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.IUIService>).Styles[(style name string in quotes)].
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> containing style settings.
